SiteOperations¶

about_a_link.py¶

clean_entries.py¶

clean_entries.clean_date(entry)¶

Cleans the date entry.

Parameters

entry (str) -- The date entry.

Returns

A datetime object representing the date sold. Otherwise, returns None if bad entry.

Return type

datetime

clean_entries.clean_price(entry)¶

Cleans the price entry.

Parameters

entry (str) -- The price entry string.

Returns

The price. Otherwise, returns None if bad entry.

Return type

float

>>> clean_price("$100,000")
100000
>>> clean_price("100") #returns None
>>>
clean_entries.clean_shipping(entry)¶

Cleans the shipping entry.

Parameters

entry (str) -- The shipping entry string.

Returns

The shipping. Otherwise, returns None if bad entry.

Return type

float

clean_entries.clean_title(entry)¶

Cleans the title entry.

Parameters

entry (str) -- The title

Returns

The cleaned title

Return type

str

fast_download.py¶

fast_download.fast_download(client, storage, sale_type, link, print_stats, deep_scrape)¶

Adds item data to storage. Item data is collected from every listing posted on the html pages, starting at the link. Until we reach an overlap point or page_count, iterate through the eBay pages. Use threads to download html concurrently. Iterate sequentially through the html text and stores useful data in storage.

Parameters

  • client (class) -- The class that provides html-downloading functionality

  • storage (pandas.DataFrame) -- The data structure that holds the item data.

  • sale_type (str) -- The type of listing. For example, items sold at 'Auction' or 'Buy it Now'.

  • link (str) -- The starting URL for scraping. All future links are obtained by calling next_link(link).

  • print_stats (bool) -- Determines whether we print stats on the scraping process.

  • deep_scrape (bool) -- Determines whether we end the search at an overlap point or not.

fast_download.html_download(client, url, i)¶

Get the HTML from the eBay page and export it to the file 'scrape_{i}.txt' for the parameter i.

Parameters

  • url (str) -- The link to the eBay page.

  • i (int) -- The page number counter.

printer.py¶

traverse_html.py¶

traverse_html.extract(html, element_type, class_name, clean_func)¶

Searches html for the contents of the first html tag of element_type and class_name. Before returning the html contents, clean the value with the clean_func.

Parameters

  • html -- a block of code representing a single listing

  • element_type (str) -- The element type of the html tag to search for. For example, div.

  • class_name (str) -- The class name of the html tag to search for.

  • clean_func (function) -- The function that converts the web text into a usable, readable format in the underlying data structure.

Returns

The return value of clean_func on the inner contents on the found html tag. Returns None if nothing is found.

Return type

Ranges from str to int to datetime.datetime.

traverse_html.find_element(html, element_type, attr_key, attr_value)¶

Returns the FIRST element found in the html code block for which the element's value at attr_key matches the attr_value.

Parameters

  • html -- The HTML block to search.

  • element_type (str) -- The HTML tag to search for.

  • attr_key (str) -- The key of an element's attribute.

  • attr_val (str) -- If the element's value at key equals attr_value, we have our match.

Returns

An HTML element within html that satisfies the condition. Returns None if an element is not found.

Return type

bs4.element.Tag or None

traverse_html.get_data(listing)¶

Returns all meaningfull item data from the html block.

Parameters

listing -- html block containing item data for a single listing.

Returns

the title, price, shipping, and date values of the listing.

Return type

tuple

traverse_html.get_listings_iteration(html)¶

Returns the total number of listings for the query and the number of page iterations.

Parameters

html -- the webpage's entire html

Returns

Returns the total number of listings for the query and the number of page iterations.

Return type

tuple

traverse_html.is_overlapping(date_stored, date_appended)¶

Determines whether date_stored is more into the past than date_appended. That is, date_appended is closer to the present day.

Parameters

date_appended (date_stored,) -- Dates in time.

Returns

True if date_appended is closer to present day than date_stored.

Return type

bool

traverse_html.next_link(old_link)¶

Given an old link to an eBay page, returns a link to the next page.

Parameters

old_link (str) -- The previous link

Returns

The next link.

Return type

str
